content.question: A model rocket of mass <math alttext="0.5 kilogram " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.5</mn><mtext> kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is launched from the ground. From time <math alttext="t equals 0 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="t equals 3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mtext> s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, the rocket’s engines exert an impulse of <math alttext="45 newton seconds " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>45</mn><mtext> N</mtext><mo>⋅</mo><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> vertically on the rocket. Assuming the mass of the rocket remains constant, the average acceleration of the rocket during this time interval is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="10 meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn><mtext> m/</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="15 meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>15</mn><mtext> m/</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="20 meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn><mtext> m/</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="30 meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn><mtext> m/</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="60 meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>60</mn><mtext> m/</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="20 meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn><mtext> m/</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
